facts.fact: Honey never spoils
facts.details: Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible

facts.fact: Octopuses have three hearts
facts.details: Two hearts pump blood to the gills, while the third circulates blood to the rest of the body

facts.fact: The Great Wall of China is not visible from space
facts.details: Contrary to popular belief, the Great Wall cannot be seen from low Earth orbit with the naked eye. This myth began in 1932 and continues despite astronaut confirmation

facts.fact: A banana is technically a berry, but a strawberry isn't
facts.details: Botanically, a berry has seeds inside the flesh, while strawberries have seeds on the outside. Bananas, tomatoes, and avocados are true berries

facts.fact: Sloths can hold their breath for up to 40 minutes underwater
facts.details: Sloths can slow their heart rate to one-third of its normal rate, allowing them to stay underwater for extended periods

facts.fact: The first computer mouse was made of wood
facts.details: Invented by Douglas Engelbart in the 1960s, the first computer mouse was made of wood and had only one button

facts.fact: The shortest war in history lasted 38 minutes
facts.details: The Anglo-Zanzibar War of 1896 began at 9:02 AM and ended at 9:40 AM, making it the shortest recorded war in history

facts.fact: Cows have best friends and get stressed when separated
facts.details: Studies have shown that cows form close emotional bonds with other cows and experience increased anxiety when separated from their preferred companions

facts.fact: The average cloud weighs 1.1 million pounds
facts.details: Clouds appear light and fluffy but are actually made up of millions of water droplets that have significant mass when combined

facts.fact: Shakespeare invented over 1,700 words
facts.details: Many common words like 'assassination', 'swagger', and 'bedroom' were first recorded in Shakespeare's works

facts.fact: Honeybees can recognize human faces
facts.details: Scientists have discovered that honeybees can be trained to recognize individual human faces through pattern recognition

facts.fact: The first person convicted of speeding was going 8 mph
facts.details: In 1896, Walter Arnold was fined for speeding at 8 mph in a 2 mph zone in Kent, England

facts.fact: A day on Mars is only 37 minutes longer than Earth
facts.details: A Martian day, called a sol, is 24 hours, 37 minutes, and 22 seconds long

facts.fact: The fingerprints of koalas are so similar to humans that they've confused crime scenes
facts.details: Koala fingerprints are virtually indistinguishable from human fingerprints, even under an electron microscope

facts.fact: The world's deepest postbox is 10 meters underwater
facts.details: Located in Susami, Japan, this underwater postbox receives about 1,500 pieces of mail annually from scuba divers

facts.fact: A jiffy is an actual unit of time
facts.details: In computing, a jiffy is 1/100th of a second. In physics, it's the time it takes light to travel one fermi (about 3×10^-24 seconds)

facts.fact: The average person spends 6 months of their lifetime waiting for red lights
facts.details: Based on average commute times and life expectancy, people spend approximately 180 days waiting at traffic signals

facts.fact: Squirrels plant thousands of new trees each year by forgetting where they put their acorns
facts.details: Squirrels only recover about 70% of their buried nuts, accidentally contributing to forest growth

facts.fact: The first email spam was sent in 1978
facts.details: Gary Thuerk sent the first spam email to 400 ARPANET users advertising Digital Equipment Corporation computers

facts.fact: The longest word without a vowel is 'rhythms'
facts.details: In standard English, 'rhythms' is the longest word without the traditional vowels (a, e, i, o, u)

facts.fact: A group of flamingos is called a flamboyance
facts.details: This collective noun reflects the birds' flamboyant appearance and social behavior

facts.fact: The Great Pyramid was the tallest man-made structure for 3,800 years
facts.details: Built around 2560 BCE, it wasn't surpassed until Lincoln Cathedral's spire in 1311 CE

facts.fact: The first person to reach both poles was a Norwegian cook
facts.details: Olav Bjaaland reached both the North and South poles as a cook on expeditions in the early 1900s

facts.fact: A bolt of lightning is five times hotter than the sun's surface
facts.details: Lightning can reach temperatures of 50,000°F (27,760°C), while the sun's surface is about 10,000°F (5,500°C)

facts.fact: The first oranges weren't orange
facts.details: The original oranges from Southeast Asia were actually green. The color orange was named after the fruit

facts.fact: Penguins have knees
facts.details: Penguins have knees, hips, and ankles hidden beneath their feathers, giving them a waddling appearance

facts.fact: The moon has moonquakes
facts.details: The moon experiences seismic activity called moonquakes, which can last for hours due to the moon's rigid structure

facts.fact: The inventor of the Pringles can was buried in a Pringles can
facts.details: Fredric Baur requested that his ashes be buried in a Pringles can when he died in 2008

facts.fact: Bananas are berries but strawberries aren't
facts.details: Botanically, bananas qualify as berries while strawberries are actually 'accessory fruits'

facts.fact: The longest time between two twins being born is 87 days
facts.details: In 2012, Maria Jones-Elliott gave birth to twins Amy and Katie with an 87-day interval

facts.fact: The first computer bug was an actual bug
facts.details: In 1947, Grace Hopper found a moth causing problems in the Harvard Mark II computer

facts.fact: Polar bears are left-handed
facts.details: Studies show that polar bears generally favor their left paw for hunting and tool use

facts.fact: The average person walks the equivalent of five times around the world in their lifetime
facts.details: Based on average daily steps, a person walks about 110,000 miles in their lifetime

facts.fact: There are more possible iterations of a game of chess than atoms in the universe
facts.details: The number of possible chess games is 10^120, while the observable universe has 10^80 atoms

facts.fact: A day on Venus is longer than its year
facts.details: Venus takes 243 Earth days to rotate once but only 225 Earth days to orbit the Sun

facts.fact: The longest word typed with just the left hand is 'stewardesses'
facts.details: Using standard QWERTY keyboard layout, 'stewardesses' is the longest word typed using only left-hand letters

facts.fact: Cats can't taste sweetness
facts.details: Cats lack the gene needed to taste sweet flavors due to evolutionary dietary habits

facts.fact: The shortest commercial flight is 1.5 minutes long
facts.details: The flight between Westray and Papa Westray in Scotland's Orkney Islands is just 1.5 miles long
